author: tempo.com
title: Lecture on decorum
text:
MOST TIMELY – Charo Santos said it very aptly: Love your work and audience.
The outgoing president and CEO of ABS-CBN was addressing actors and actresses at the recent Star Magic Ball.
Ms. Santos’ words were most timely as one of the network’s most promising actor, Enrique Gil, was involved in a disgusting incident on his way to London via PAL.
With Enrique were, among others, co-actors Luis Manzano, Paulo Avelino, Jake Cuenca, Jessy Mendiola, and Liza Soberano. Liza is Enrique’s sweetheart.
Enrique had one drink too many before he boarded the plane and continued drinking while on flight. He annoyed — to put it very mildly — Luis, Jessy, and even Liza, causing a commotion.
Paulo and Jake, Enrique’s drinking buddies, were tightlipped on the incident.
•
DISPLINARY ACTION – Jessy’s mother is thinking of legal action against Enrique, but perhaps a court case may not be needed if ABS-CBN management takes disciplinary action against its artist.
Sure, Enrique has publicly apologized, but that may not be enough. A suspension is in order.
•
PROFESSIONAL BUT – Back to Ms. Santos’ words, about actors loving their work and audience.
In fairness, Enrique loves his work, his craft. He has improved considerably as an actor. Also, Enrique is professional on the set, hardworking and dedicated.
But it seems he doesn’t love his audience, judging from his bad behavior. And the PAL incident isn’t the first time.
Twice before Enrique got into trouble because of too much alcohol.
A bad example for his many followers, young and old alike.
•
LECTURE ON – So please, Ma’am Charo, initiate a lecture (extensive one) on decorum, courtesy, etiquette. Make attendance a must, including even well-behaved stars like Piolo Pascual and Julia Montes.
Or Coco Martin and Matteo Guidicelli, although years back they had a fight which was immediately settled.
By all means, the following stars should be asked, required, to attend the lecture.
As they come to mind: John Lloyd Cruz, Baron Geisler, Ellen Adarna, Kim Chiu, Xian Lim, Claudine Baretto, JM de Guzman, Anne Curtis, Paulo Avelino, Jake Cuenca, Angelika Panganiban, Maja Salvador, Billy Crawford, Colleen Garcia. And of course ENRIQUE GIL.
